title: [bug] pytorch doesn`t work after caffe2 installation
body_html:
Issue description

I have installed from source (git clone) pytorch, then caffe2. After installation of caffe2, I cannot import torch package:

Code example

Python 2.7.12 (default, Dec 4 2017, 14:50:18)
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.

import torch
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "", line 1, in
File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/caffe2-0.8.2-py2.7-linux-x86_64.egg/torch/init.py", line 14, in
from .version import version
ImportError: No module named version

System Info

Please copy and paste the output from our environment collection script

python collect_env.py 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "collect_env.py", line 11, in <module>
    import torch
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/caffe2-0.8.2-py2.7-linux-x86_64.egg/torch/__init__.py", line 14, in <module>
    from .version import __version__
ImportError: No module named version
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source):
git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch
cd pytorch
sudo python setup.py install
sudo python setup_caffe2.py install

  • Build command you used (if compiling from source):

  • OS:
    Ubuntu 16.04

  • PyTorch version:
    664fe34

  • Python version:
    2.7

  • CUDA/cuDNN version:
    CUDA 8.0

  • GPU models and configuration:
    laptop GeForce 940M

  • GCC version (if compiling from source):
    gcc (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.6) 5.4.0 20160609

  • CMake version:
    cmake version 3.9.0-rc2

  • Versions of any other relevant libraries:

body:
## Issue description

I have installed from source (git clone) pytorch, then caffe2. After installation of caffe2, I cannot import torch package:

## Code example

Python 2.7.12 (default, Dec  4 2017, 14:50:18) 
[GCC 5.4.0 20160609] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import torch
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/caffe2-0.8.2-py2.7-linux-x86_64.egg/torch/__init__.py", line 14, in <module>
    from .version import __version__
ImportError: No module named version

## System Info
Please copy and paste the output from our environment collection script

```
python collect_env.py 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "collect_env.py", line 11, in <module>
    import torch
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/caffe2-0.8.2-py2.7-linux-x86_64.egg/torch/__init__.py", line 14, in <module>
    from .version import __version__
ImportError: No module named version

```
- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source):


```
git clone --recursive https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch
cd pytorch
sudo python setup.py install
sudo python setup_caffe2.py install
```

- Build command you used (if compiling from source):
- OS:
Ubuntu 16.04
- PyTorch version:
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/commit/664fe34e0a28318947edaa562247be7b583c1ee7

- Python version:
2.7
- CUDA/cuDNN version:
CUDA 8.0

- GPU models and configuration:
laptop GeForce 940M 

- GCC version (if compiling from source):
gcc (Ubuntu 5.4.0-6ubuntu1~16.04.6) 5.4.0 20160609
- CMake version:
cmake version 3.9.0-rc2
- Versions of any other relevant libraries:
